intro: Hieracium aestivum subsp. subcrocatum, commonly known as the summer hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of dark green, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers in clusters during the summer months. The plant is native to Central and Eastern Europe and thrives in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. It has a taproot system and is often found in open, sunny habitats. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly smaller flowers and shorter peduncles compared to other members of the species.
